intro: Salmea verticillata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. Salmea verticillata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
